etymology.description: 电话 (telephone) + 号码 (number) = telephone number
etymology.interpretation: Combines the communication medium with a numeric identifier to refer to the specific digits used to reach someone by phone. Emphasizes the identifying sequence rather than the device.
etymology.simplification: All four characters were simplified in the PRC to reduce strokes and standardize radicals: 電→电, 話→话 (speech radical 讠), 號→号, 碼→码 (马).

parts.english: telephone; phone; phone call; to call

examples.chinese: 请把你的电话号码写在这里(請把你的電話號碼寫在這裡)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ nǐ de diànhuà hàomǎ xiě zài zhèlǐ.
examples.english: Please write your phone number here.

examples.chinese: 他换了电话号码，所以我联系不上他(他換了電話號碼，所以我聯繫不上他)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huàn le diànhuà hàomǎ, suǒyǐ wǒ liánxì bù shàng tā.
examples.english: He changed his phone number, so I can't reach him.

examples.chinese: 这个公司有多个客服电话号码(這個公司有多個客服電話號碼)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège gōngsī yǒu duō gè kèfú diànhuà hàomǎ.
examples.english: This company has multiple customer-service phone numbers.
